intro: Aeollanthus canescens, commonly known as the roughleaf dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It produces small, wind-dispersed seeds that contribute to its spread. Aeollanthus canescens is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
